data.chText: （强烈的）反对，反抗，对抗
data.enText: the act of strongly disagreeing with sb/sth, especially with the aim of preventing sth from happening

data.chText: 代表强烈反对这些计划。
data.enText: Delegates expressed strong opposition to the plans.

data.chText: 军队在每一座城镇都遭遇到了顽强的抵抗。
data.enText: The army met with fierce opposition in every town.

data.chText: 他因为反对那个政权而过了五年的铁窗生活。
data.enText: He spent five years in prison for his opposition to the regime.

data.chText: 反对势力
data.enText: opposition forces (= people who are arguing, fighting, etc. with another group)

data.chText: （事业、竞赛、游戏等的）对手，敌手，竞争者

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的单数名词

data.enText: the people you are competing against in business, a competition, a game, etc.

data.chText: 他去为竞争对手工作了。
data.enText: He's gone to work for the opposition.

data.chText: 对方正对我方企业逐渐形成强大的挑战。
data.enText: The opposition is/are mounting a strong challenge to our business.

data.chText: 利物浦队在决赛中不敌对手，以0:2输掉比赛。
data.enText: Liverpool couldn't match the opposition in the final and lost 2–0.

data.chText: 反对党；在野党

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的单数名词

data.enText: the main political party that is opposed to the government; the political parties that are in a parliament but are not part of the government

data.chText: 反对党领袖
data.enText: the leader of the Opposition

data.chText: 反对党议员；反对党派
data.enText: Opposition MPs/parties

data.chText: 反对党教育事务发言人
data.enText: the Opposition spokesman on education

data.chText: 对立；对立的事物
data.enText: the state of being as different as possible; two things that are as different as possible

data.chText: 善与恶的对立
data.enText: the opposition between good and evil

data.chText: 他的诗歌充满了对立与对比。
data.enText: His poetry is full of oppositions and contrasts.

data.chText: 反对团体 / 策略
data.enText: oppositional groups/tactics
in opposition

data.chText: 反对党的；在野的
data.enText: forming part of a parliament but not part of the government
in opposition to sb/sth

data.chText: 强烈反对（或抵制）某人 / 某事物
data.enText: disagreeing strongly with sb/sth, especially with the aim of preventing sth from happening

data.chText: 为抗议新提出的法规举行了示威游行。
data.enText: Protest marches were held in opposition to the proposed law.

data.chText: 对比；对照
data.enText: contrasting two people or things that are very different

data.chText: 休闲常被定义为工作的反面。
data.enText: Leisure is often defined in opposition to work.

simple_means.memory_skill: oppose 反对 + ition 行为 → 相反；反对

ex.chText: 他提出的反对理由是她没有经验。
ex.enText: His objection was that she had no experience.

ex.chText: 他对计划提出了反对意见。
ex.enText: He raised an objection to the plan.

ex.chText: 我们概述了对该建议的主要反对意见。
ex.enText: We outlined our main objections to the proposal.

synonyms.bx: 指异议或持有异议的理由。

ex.enText: The teacher shook her head in disapproval.

ex.chText: 她对他们所做的事表示极不赞成。
ex.enText: She showed strong disapproval for what they had done.

synonyms.bx: 指认为某人或其行为、主张等错误或不恰当而表现出的态度。

ex.chText: 新的税务计划遭到强烈反对。
ex.enText: The new tax program met with fierce opposition.

ex.chText: 他们遭到了当地居民的激烈反对。
ex.enText: They face strong opposition from local residents.

synonyms.bx: 指对计划、法律、制度等的强烈不满或抵制。

data.enText: in opposition

data.chText: 反对党的；在野的
data.enText: forming part of a parliament but not part of the government
in opposition to sb/sth

data.chText: 强烈反对（或抵制）某人 / 某事物
data.enText: disagreeing strongly with sb/sth, especially with the aim of preventing sth from happening

data.chText: 为抗议新提出的法规举行了示威游行。
data.enText: Protest marches were held in opposition to the proposed law.

data.chText: 对比；对照
data.enText: contrasting two people or things that are very different

data.chText: 休闲常被定义为工作的反面。
data.enText: Leisure is often defined in opposition to work.

tr: the action of opposing something that you disapprove or disagree with
example: he encountered a general feeling of resistance from many citizens
despite opposition from the newspapers he went ahead

tr: the act of hostile groups opposing each other
example: the government was not ready for a confrontation with the unions

tr: a body of people united in opposing something
an armed adversary (especially a member of an opposing military force)
example: a soldier must be prepared to kill his enemies

tr: a contestant that you are matched against

value.def: Opposition is strong, angry, or violent disagreement and disapproval.

example.ex: The government is facing a new wave of opposition in the form of a student strike...
example.tran: 政府面临着学生通过罢课掀起的新一轮反对浪潮。

example.ex: Much of the opposition to this plan has come from the media.
example.tran: 该计划的主要反对声音来自媒体。

value.def: The opposition is the political parties or groups that are opposed to a government.

example.ex: The main opposition parties boycotted the election, saying it would not be conducted fairly.
example.tran: 主要反对党联合抵制这次选举，认为该选举将缺乏公正性。

value.tran: （与政府意见相左的）反对党，在野党，反对派

value.def: In a country's parliament or legislature, the opposition refers to the politicians or political parties that form part of the parliament or legislature, but are not the government.
value.tran: （议会或立法机构中的）反对党，在野党，反对派

value.def: The opposition is the person or team you are competing against in a sports event.

example.ex: Poland provide the opposition for the Scots' last warm-up match at home.
example.tran: 苏格兰队在国内最后一场热身赛的对手是波兰队。

value.tran: （体育比赛中的）对手，竞争者，竞争队伍

rootsaffixes.indicate: 表名词，“行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物”
rootsaffixes.title: -ition

partsOfSpeech.dec: add 增加 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 加；增加的人（或物）
aud 听 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → （对艺人的）面试（指试演、试唱等）
partsOfSpeech.d: （对艺人的）面试（指试演、试唱等）

partsOfSpeech.dec: compose 创作；合成 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 创作；构成
define 下定义 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 定义
oppose 反对 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 相反；反对
pet 寻求 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 力争实现要求 → 请愿
pre 预先 + cogn 知道 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 预感
re 一再 + quis 寻求 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 请求
suppose 猜想 + ition 行为，状态，结果，由行为产生的事物 → 猜想
